definition: clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: The world is a stunning place, full of outstanding works of art.
sentences.chinese: 这个世界是令人惊叹的，到处都是让人叹服的艺术品。

sentences.english: George dazzled her with his knowledge of the world.
sentences.chinese: 乔治的洞察世情令她叹服。

sentences.english: His unexpected surprising conceits make people astonished and admired.
sentences.chinese: 他的出人意料的比喻令人吃惊之余深为叹服。

sentences.english: We felt at home with her and were impressed with the depth of her knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 我们与她在一起很放松，她渊博的知识令我们叹服。

sentences.english: Just give them a little more time and they will almost always impress you.
sentences.chinese: 给他们多一点儿时间，他们将几乎总能让你叹服。

sentences.english: This kind of strong heart is really amazing.
sentences.chinese: 这种内心的刚强着实让人叹服。

sentences.english: It was an impressive performance by the French team.
sentences.chinese: 那是法国队一次令人叹服的表示。

definition: (idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to convince/to subdue/to be convinced/to be bowled over
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
to consider oneself as being not as good as the others
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
ashamed of being inferior (idiom)/to feel inferior to others
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
to feel ashamed at being inferior (idiom)
